summary.long: 2 Thessalonians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul and Silvanus and Timothy, to the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We ought to give thanks to God always concerning you, brothers, just as it is fitting, because your faith is flourishing and the love of each one of you all toward one another is increasing
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that we ourselves boast in you in the churches of God about your patient endurance and faith in all your persecutions and the afflictions that you are enduring,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a proof of the righteous judgment of God, so that you may be considered worthy of the kingdom of God, on behalf of which also you are suffering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since it is righteous in the sight of God to pay back those who are afflicting you with affliction,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to you who are being afflicted, rest with us at the revelation of the Lord Jesus from heaven with his powerful angels,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with burning flame giving punishment to those who do not know God and who do not obey the gospel of our Lord Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who will pay the penalty of eternal destruction, away from the presence of the Lord and from the glory of his strength,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whenever he should come to be glorified on that day by his saints and to be marveled at by all who believe, because our testimony was believed among you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for which purpose we also pray always for you, that you may be considered worthy of the calling of our God, and he might fulfill every desire for goodness and work of faith with power,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order that the name of our Lord Jesus may be glorified in you, and you in him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we ask you, brothers, concerning the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and our assembling to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you not be easily shaken from your composure, nor be troubled either by a spirit or by a message or by a letter alleged to be from us, to the effect that the day of the Lord has arrived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not let anyone deceive you in any way, for that day will not come unless the rebellion comes first, and the man of lawlessness is revealed, the son of destruction,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who opposes and who exalts himself over every so-called god or object of worship, so that he sits down in the temple of God, proclaiming that he himself is God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not remember that while we were still with you, we were saying these things to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you know that which restrains him now, so that he will be revealed in his own time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the mystery of lawlessness is at work already; only the one who now restrains will do so until he is out of the way,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then the lawless one will be revealed, whom the Lord Jesus will slay with the breath of his mouth, and wipe out by the appearance of his coming,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whose coming is in accordance with the working of Satan, with all power and signs and lying wonders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with every unrighteous deception against those who are perishing, in place of which they did not accept the love of the truth, so that they would be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because of this, God sends them a powerful delusion so that they will believe the lie,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order that all may be condemned who did not believe the truth, but delighted in unrighteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we ought to give thanks to God always concerning you, brothers dearly loved by the Lord, because God has chosen you as first fruits for salvation by the sanctification of the Spirit and faith in the truth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for which purpose he called you through our gospel for the obtaining of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, brothers, stand firm and hold fast to the traditions which you were taught, whether by spoken word or by letter from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now may our Lord Jesus Christ himself and God our Father, who has loved us and given us eternal encouragement and good hope by grace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: encourage your hearts and strengthen you in every good work and word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, brothers, pray for us, that the word of the Lord may progress and be honored, just as also it was with you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that we may be delivered from evil and wicked people, for not all have the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord is faithful, who will strengthen you and guard you from the evil one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we have confidence in the Lord about you, that you are both doing and you will do the things that we are commanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now may the Lord direct your hearts toward the love of God and toward the patient endurance of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we command you, brothers, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you keep away from every brother who lives irresponsibly and not according to the tradition that they received from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you yourselves know how it is necessary to imitate us, that we did not behave irresponsibly among you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor did we eat bread from anyone without paying, but with toil and labor, we were working night and day in order not to be a burden to any of you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not that we do not have the right, but so that we may give ourselves as an example to you, so that you may imitate us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even when we were with you, we used to command this to you: that if anyone does not want to work, neither should he eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we hear that some among you are living irresponsibly, working at nothing, but being busybodies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we command and we exhort such people in the Lord Jesus Christ that, working with quietness, they eat their own bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you, brothers, do not be discouraged while doing what is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone does not obey our message through this letter, take note not to associate with him, in order that he may be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And do not consider him as an enemy, but admonish him as a brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now may the Lord of peace himself grant you peace through everything in every way. May the Lord be with all of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The greeting is by my hand, Paul’s, which is a sign of genuineness in every letter: this is how I write.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with all of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
